00029 #ifndef RESISTOR_H
00030 #define RESISTOR_H
00031 
00032 #include "element.h"
00033 #include "BMatrix.h"
00034 #include <string>
00035 #include "Circuit.h"
00036 
00037 #include "symbolicc++.h"
00038 
00039 class resistor : public TwoTerminal
00040 {
00041   
00042 private:
00043         double value;
00044         
00045         
00046 public:
00047                 
00048         resistor(std::string _n1, std::string _n2, double _value):TwoTerminal(_n1,_n2),value(_value){
00049              name = std::string("R")+".+"+n1+".-"+n2;
00050         }
00051         
00052         resistor(std::string _name, std::string _n1, std::string _n2, double _value):TwoTerminal(_n1,_n2),value(_value){
00053           name =_name;
00054         };
00055 
00056         
00057         bool is_linear(){return true;}
00058         
00059         virtual void write_stamp(BMatrix::Sparse<double> &G, BMatrix::Sparse<double> &C, Circuit* circ);
00060         
00061         void add_my_nodes(Circuit* circuit);
00062         
00063 
00064         
00065 };

00067 /*----------Class of non Linear Resistors---------------*/
00068 class nonlin_resistor: public TwoTerminal
00069 {
00070   
00071 private:
00072       int n1_index; //the index of node1
00073       int n2_index; //the index of node2
00074       std::string Curr_Expression;
00075         
00076       Symbolic F; //The non linear function 
00077       
00078       
00079       //The Shunting Yard algorithm is used to parse Mathematical Expressions
00080       //This function is a modefied version of the code found in "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shunting_yard_algorithm"
00081       void shunting_yard();
00082       
00083       //the following functions are used for shunting Yard algorithm
00084       static bool is_numeric(const std::string& c); //if it is a numeric token
00085       static bool is_voltage_current(const std::string& c , std::string& dependent); //check if it is a voltage or current token
00086       std::string get_expression_token(int& pos);
00087       static int op_preced(const char* c);
00088       static bool op_left_assoc(const char* c);
00089       static Symbolic do_operator( vector<Symbolic>::iterator left ,  vector<Symbolic>::iterator right , const char* op );
00090       static Symbolic do_operator( vector<Symbolic>::iterator left , const char* op );
00091 public:
00092                 
00093         nonlin_resistor(std::string _n1, std::string _n2, const char* _curr_expression):TwoTerminal(_n1,_n2),Curr_Expression(_curr_expression){
00094              name = std::string("nlR")+".+"+n1+".-"+n2;
00095              
00096              //add paranthesis to the expression. It is required for the  shunting_yard algorithm to make sure the expression is done
00097              Curr_Expression = std::string("(") + Curr_Expression;
00098              Curr_Expression += ")";
00099              
00100         }
00101         
00102         nonlin_resistor(std::string _name, std::string _n1, std::string _n2, const char* _curr_expression):TwoTerminal(_n1,_n2),Curr_Expression(_curr_expression){
00103              name =_name;
00104              
00105              //add paranthesis to the expression. It is required for the  shunting_yard algorithm to make sure the expression is done
00106              Curr_Expression = std::string("(") + Curr_Expression;
00107              Curr_Expression += ")";
00108              
00109         };
00110 
00111         
00112         bool is_linear(){return false;}
00113         
00114         virtual void write_stamp(BMatrix::Sparse<double> &G, BMatrix::Sparse<double> &C, Circuit* circ);
00115         
00116         void add_my_nodes(Circuit* circuit);
00117 };
